titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. E. H. Daniels and Reuben T. Daniels, Indictment
CWG7542

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Caldwell Circuit,, Court,,
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,,
Against } June Term 1865,
E,, H,, Daniels,, Reuben,, T,, Daniels

The Grand Jury of Caldwell County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: accuse E,, H,, Daniels and Reuben,, T,, Daniels,, of the offence of keeping a gaming table committed as follows. viz: The said E,, H,, Daniels. and Reuben,, T,, Daniels, on the 10th day of February 1865. and on divers other days and times before and Since that time in the County aforesaid,, they being licensed coffee house keepers,, did willfully and knowingly and for gaming purposes,, set up exhibit and keep in a house in their possession occupation and under their control and for the purpose aforesaid,, a machine contrivance or table,, called a Jennie Lind Table,, used in betting and playing games of chance, and on which table or contrivance as aforesaid money, property and other things of value were bett wagered won and lost on said games of chance played on the same against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

J W McCoy
Foreman, Grand Jury, E P Campbell attorney for the Commonwealth,

a copy
attest J C Barnes Clk
By F W Dabney D C

Information given by=
A. C. Mayes,,
W,, T,, Scott,,
Perry Blount,,
D. H. Wylie,,
J. J. Wylie,,
James. S. Wylie,,
F. W. Dabney,,
E. B. Ford,,
T. A. Lowey
Jerome, B, Ford,,
A, D, Alexander,,
Robert, Overby,,
Frank, Darby,,
John. W, Cook,,
Geo. Coon,,
Clay, Coon,,
Bench Warrant to issue and bail fixed for each at $600.00

A Copy
attest F, W, Dabney D C

Comlth
vs } Indictment for Keeping a gaming table
Daniels & Daniels
A true bill
J W McCoy
foreman Grand Jury
Filed and Noted in open Court June 12th 1865
att F W Dabney D C
Issd
A Copy
fee 30,Â¢
Campbell atty
